info.title: Browse AI API Documentation
info.description: If you are still using the deprecated API v1 version, you can see its documentation [here](https://www.browse.ai/docs/api/v1).

tags.name: internal
tags.description: There are some endpoints that are only used by our integrations, so we don't add this tag to our core resources

tags.name: robots
tags.description:
A robot can be trained do almost anything you do manually on the web. For example:

  - Open a webpage,
  - Log in,
  - Click on buttons,
  - Fill out forms,
  - Extract structured data from a webpage into a spreadsheet,
  - Take screenshots,
  - Monitor specific parts of webpages for visual or content changes.

Robots are created either by using Prebuilt Robots or using Browse AI Recorder and its click-and-extract interface.  Every robot has a few input parameters (like the webpage address) that you can adjust every time you run it.

tags.name: tasks
tags.description:
Each robot is trained to perform a certain task. Every time you run that robot, it will perform that task and the  details, including the extracted data, will be stored under that task.

If you set up a monitoring robot to monitor a webpage for changes daily,  it will have to run a task every day or about 30 tasks per month for you.

tags.name: monitors
tags.description:
Each robot on Browse AI can optionally have one or more monitors. Monitoring robots come with one monitor by default.

For example, if you set up a monitoring robot to monitor a category page on an e-commerce site for changes daily,  you can set up additional monitors to monitor other category pages on the same site using the same robot.

Each monitor can have different input parameters and schedule.

tags.name: webhooks
tags.description: After a robot finishes a task, its webhooks will be called.

tags.name: bulk runs
tags.description: You can run up to 1,000 tasks at once using a robot with different input parameters for each task.

get.summary: Retrieve list of teams under user account
get.description: this endpoint be used on Browse AI integrations to fetch all of the teams by auth0 access token

x-codeSamples.label: C#
Go
x-codeSamples.source:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.browse.ai/v2/teams"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

Node (Native)
Node (request)
Objective-C
PHP
x-codeSamples.source:
<?php

$curl = curl_init();

curl_setopt_array($curl, [
  CURLOPT_URL => "https://api.browse.ai/v2/teams",
  CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
  CURLOPT_ENCODING => "",
  CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
  CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
  CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
  CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => "GET",
  CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => [
    "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY"
  ],
]);

$response = curl_exec($curl);
$err = curl_error($curl);

curl_close($curl);

if ($err) {
  echo "cURL Error #:" . $err;
} else {
  echo $response;
}

x-codeSamples.label: Ruby
x-codeSamples.source:
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'
require 'openssl'

url = URI("https://api.browse.ai/v2/teams")

http = Net::HTTP.new(url.host, url.port)
http.use_ssl = true
http.verify_mode = OpenSSL::SSL::VERIFY_NONE

request = Net::HTTP::Get.new(url)
request["Authorization"] = 'Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY'

response = http.request(request)
puts response.read_body

get.summary: Retrieve list of robots under your account
get.description:
If you have already created a few robots on [your dashboard](https://dashboard.browse.ai), you can use this endpoint to retrieve a list of them.
  
You can then use other endpoints to retrieve more information about your robots or run robots.

get.summary: Get all tasks by a robot
get.description: Get all of a robot's tasks

parameters.name: robotId
parameters.description:
Unique robot ID

You can find a robot's ID by opening it on the dashboard and copying its ID in the browser address bar.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Task status

parameters.name: includeRetried
parameters.description: by passing false you can exclude the retried tasks

parameters.name: fromDate
parameters.description: From task creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

parameters.name: toDate
parameters.description: To task creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

post.description:
Run a robot on-demand with custom input parameters.

When you need to run a robot and get its captured data, you can use this endpoint to run  the task, and then use webhooks to receive the captured data as soon as the task is finished.  Alternatively, you can poll the GET endpoint to retrieve a task's details as soon as it is finished.

parameters.name: robotId
parameters.description:
Unique robot ID

You can find a robot's ID by opening it on the dashboard and copying its ID in the browser address bar.

x-codeSamples.label: C#
Go
x-codeSamples.source:
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"strings"
	"net/http"
	"io/ioutil"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.browse.ai/v2/robots/{robotId}/tasks"

	payload := strings.NewReader("{\"inputParameters\":{\"originUrl\":\"https://www.espressozone.com/espresso-machines/semi-automatic-espresso-machines\"}}")

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("POST", url, payload)

	req.Header.Add("Authorization", "Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := ioutil.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

x-codeSamples.source:
HttpResponse<String> response = Unirest.post("https://api.browse.ai/v2/robots/{robotId}/tasks")
  .header("Authorization", "Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY")
  .body("{\"inputParameters\":{\"originUrl\":\"https://www.espressozone.com/espresso-machines/semi-automatic-espresso-machines\"}}")
  .asString();

createdAt.description: Team creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

totalCount.description: Total number of Team this user has.

encrypted.description: Whether parameter value and defaultValue are encrypted

defaultValue.description: Parameter default value that will be used as a fallback if you do not specify a parameter's value when running a robot. If `encrypted` is `true`, this will appear as an arbitrary string like `******`. Parameter default values can be updated on robot Settings page on your dashboard.

value.description:
Parameter value specified when running robot. If `encrypted` is `true`, this will appear as an arbitrary string like `******`. type:
  type: string
  enum: ["text"]
  example: "text"
  description: Parameter type
pattern:
  type: string
  description: Parameter Pattern

defaultValue.description: Parameter default value that will be used if you do not specify a parameter's value when running a robot.

value.description: Parameter value specified when running robot.

createdAt.description: Robot creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

totalCount.description: Total number of robots this team has.

InputParameters.description: An object of input parameters to override default input parameters.

CapturedScreenshots.description: All screenshots captured in this task.

x.description: Screenshot rectangle distance from the left edge of the page in pixels

y.description: Screenshot rectangle distance from the top edge of the page in pixels

deviceScaleFactor.description: Device scale factor when screenshot was taken

full.description:
Whether this is a full *page* screenshot, a *viewport* screenshot, or a different type of screenshot.

`null` means it is either an HTML element screenshot or a particular rectangle (x, y, w, h) screenshot.

comparedToScreenshotId.description: If screenshot was taken in a monitoring check, this is the ID of the screenshot it was compared to.

diffImageSrc.description: A transparent PNG highlighting changes compared to previous screenshot in red

changePercentage.description: How much screenshot changed compared to previous screenshot

diffThreshold.description: The change percentage threshold above which the user would be notified of the change, based on monitor settings.

fileRemovedAt.description: After your account's data retention period, screenshots get removed and  this field will be screenshot removal date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

CapturedLists.description: All lists captured in this task.

companies.name: Coin base
companies.description: Buy, sell, and manage crypto currencies.

runByUserId.description: User ID who ran the robot on the dashboard

runByTaskMonitorId.description: Monitor ID that ran this check

runByAPI.description: Whether the robot was ran through the API

createdAt.description: Task creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

startedAt.description: Task start date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp

finishedAt.description:
Task finish date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

If `null`, it means robot is still running and capturing data.

Tasks time out with an error if they are not finished within 15 minutes (or the maximum duration allowed on your plan).

userFriendlyError.description: If task fails, a user-friendly error will be provided here.

triedRecordingVideo.description:
Whether the robot tried to record a video while performing this task.

You can change a robot's video recording setting on its Settings page. 

Robots try to record a video when a task is failed and auto-retried as well.

videoUrl.description: If a video was recorded for this task, this is the link to the video.

videoRemovedAt.description: After your account's data retention period, task videos get removed and  this field will be video removal date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

retriedOriginalTaskId.description: The ID of the original failed task this task was retrying. For example, if task A failed and was retried by task B, and task B was retried by task C, `retriedOriginalTaskId` will point to task A in both task B and C.

retriedByTaskId.description:
The ID of the task that retried this task, if this task failed with an error and was retried.

Failed tasks get retried if "Double Check" option is enabled on robot Settings page. "Double Check" is enabled by default.

capturedDataTemporaryUrl.description: If your task's captured data exceeds 100KB, the data will be only accessible through this link. Theres's a 24 hours expiration time for this link (you need to call this API again to get a new link if it expires).

totalCount.description: Total number of tasks this robot has.

hasMore.description: Whether there are more tasks on the next page.

recordVideo.description: Try to record a video while running the task. This is not guaranteed to work as the robot might skip video recording if the site is too heavy.

notifyOnCapturedScreenshotChange.description: If set to `true`, an email notification will be sent to you when a change is detected in captured screenshots.

notifyOnCapturedTextChange.description: If set to `true`, an email notification will be sent to you when a change is detected in captured texts.

capturedScreenshotNotificationThreshold.description: The "screenshot changed" email notification will be sent to you if the change is greater than this threshold (in percent).

createdAt.description: Monitor creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

pausedAt.description: Monitor pause date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

updatedAt.description: Monitor last update date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

totalCount.description: Total number of monitors this robot has

inputParameters.description: An object of input parameters to override default input parameters.

notifyOnCapturedTextChange.description: If set to `true`, an email notification will be sent to you when a change is detected in captured texts.

capturedScreenshotNotificationThreshold.description: The "screenshot changed" email notification will be sent to you if the change is greater than this threshold (in percent).

title.description: An optional string that describes the bulk run.

tasksCount.description: Number of tasks under this bulk run.

createdAt.description: Bulk run creation date and time in the form of a Unix timestamp.

totalCount.description: Total number of bulk runs a robot has had.

hasMore.description: Whether there are more bulk runs on the next page.

ArrayOfUserInputParameters.description: An array of input parameters to override the task's default input parameters.

authorization.name: authorization
authorization.description: Example: 'Bearer YOUR_SECRET_API_KEY' You can generate a new API key on [your dashboard](https://dashboard.browse.ai/account/api) if you do not have one.
